description.para: Evaluates an expression and if the expression is FALSE, displays a diagnostic message and enters kernel debug mode.

param_note.para: Expression (including pointers) that evaluates to nonzero or 0.

remarks.para: The verify macro is used to identify logical errors during program development by implementing the expression argument to evaluate to false, only if the program is not operating properly.

In debug and release versions, verify macro displays a diagnostic message if the expression is false (0), and makes the kernel enter debug mode. No action is taken if expression is true (nonzero). The diagnostic message includes the failed expression, the name of the source file and line number where the assertion failed.
In NAKED version, verify macro evaluates the expression, but does not display any diagnostic message or make the kernel to enter debug mode.
